member.name: T:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmm
member.summary: IVI DMM class-compliant root interface

member.name: M:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmm.Initialize(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Opens the I/O session to the instrument. Driver methods and properties that access the instrument are only accessible after Initialize is called. Initialize optionally performs a Reset and queries the instrument to validate the instrument model.
member.param: An IVI logical name or an instrument specific string that identifies the address of the instrument, such as a VISA resource descriptor string.
Specifies whether to verify the ID of the instrument.
Specifies whether to reset the instrument.

The user can use the OptionsString parameter to specify the initial values of certain IVI inherent attributes for the session. The format of an assignment in the OptionsString parameter is "Name=Value", where Name is one of: RangeCheck, QuerytInstrStatus, Cache, Simulate, RecordCoercions, InterchangeCheck, or DriverSetup. Value is either true or false except for DriverSetup. If the Options String parameter contains an assignment for the Driver Setup attribute, the Initialize function assumes that everything following "DriverSetup=" is part of the assignment.

member.name: M:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmm.Close
member.summary: Closes the I/O session to the instrument. Driver methods and properties that access the instrument are not accessible after Close is called.

member.name: M:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmm.Configure(Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmFunctionEnum,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Configures the Function, Range, and Resolution properties. If the value of the Range parameter is Auto Range On, then the Resolution parameter is ignored.
member.param: Determines the units for the Range and Resolution Absolute parameters, and the measurement values that are returned by the Read, Read Multiple Point, Fetch, and Fetch Multiple Point methods.

The measurement range. Positive values represent the absolute value of the maximum measurement expected. The driver coerces this value to the appropriate range for the instrument. Negative values represent the Auto Range mode.
The measurement resolution in absolute units.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmm.DriverOperation
member.summary: Pointer to the IIviDriverOperation interface

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmm.Identity
member.summary: Pointer to the IIviDriverIdentity interface

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmm.Utility
member.summary: Pointer to the IIviDriverUtility interface

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmm.Initialized
member.summary: Initialized is True between a successful call to the Initialize method and a successful call to the Close method, and False at all other times.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmm.Function
member.summary: The measurement function. This property determines the units for Range and Resolution and the values returned by the Read, Read Multiple Point, Fetch, and Fetch Multiple Point methods.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmm.Range
member.summary: The measurement range, coerced by the driver to the appropriate range for the instrument. Positive values set the absolute value of the maximum measurement expected. Negative values set Auto Range mode. Units are determined by Function.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmm.Resolution
member.summary: The measurement resolution in absolute units. Units are determined by Function.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmm.AC
member.summary: Pointer to the class-compliant IIviDmmAc interface

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmm.Advanced
member.summary: Pointer to the class-compliant IIviDmmAdvanced interface

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmm.Frequency
member.summary: Pointer to the class-compliant IIviDmmFrequency interface

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmm.Measurement
member.summary: Pointer to the class-compliant IIviDmmMeasurement interface

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmm.Temperature
member.summary: Pointer to the class-compliant IIviDmmTemperature interface

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmm.Trigger
member.summary: Pointer to the class-compliant IIviDmmTrigger interface

member.name: T:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmAC
member.summary: IVI DMM class-compliant AC interface

member.name: M:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmAC.ConfigureBandwidth(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Configures the FrequencyMax and FrequencyMin properties for DMMs that take AC voltage or AC current measurements.
member.param: The minimum frequency component of the input signal for AC measurements.
The maximum frequency component of the input signal for AC measurements.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmAC.FrequencyMax
member.summary: The maximum frequency component of the input signal for AC measurements. The value of this property affects instrument behavior only when the Function property is set to an AC voltage or AC current measurement.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmAC.FrequencyMin
member.summary: The minimum frequency component of the input signal for AC measurements. The value of this property affects instrument behavior only when the Function property is set to an AC voltage or AC current measurement.

member.name: T:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmAdvanced
member.summary: IVI DMM class-compliant advanced features interface

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmAdvanced.ActualRange
member.summary: The actual range that the DMM is currently using, even if it is auto-ranging.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmAdvanced.ApertureTime
member.summary: The measurement aperture time (also known as integration time) based on the present configuration. Units are specified by the property ApertureTimeUnits.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmAdvanced.ApertureTimeUnits
member.summary: The units for the ApertureTime property.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmAdvanced.AutoZero
member.summary: The auto-zero mode. When the auto-zero mode is enabled, the DMM internally disconnects the input signal and takes a Zero Reading. The DMM then subtracts the Zero Reading from the measurement.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmAdvanced.PowerlineFrequency
member.summary: The power line frequency in Hertz.

member.name: T:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmFrequency
member.summary: IVI DMM class-compliant frequency interface

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmFrequency.VoltageRange
member.summary: The expected maximum voltage level of the input signal for frequency and period measurements. Positive values set the manual range. Negative values set Auto Range mode. The units are specified in Volts RMS.

member.name: T:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmMeasurement
member.summary: IVI DMM class-compliant measurement interface

member.name: M:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmMeasurement.Initiate
member.summary: Initiates a measurement. When this method executes, the DMM leaves the idle state and waits for a trigger.

member.name: M:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmMeasurement.Abort
member.summary: Aborts a previously initiated measurement and returns the DMM to the idle state.

member.name: M:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmMeasurement.Fetch(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the measured value from a measurement that the Initiate method initiates. If an overrange condition occurs, the value contains IEEE NaN and the method returns an overrange error.
member.param: The maximum time allowed for the measurement to complete in milliseconds. May also be a value defined in IviDmmMaxTimeEnum.

member.name: M:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmMeasurement.FetchMultiPoint(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an array of values from a measurement that the Initiate method initiates. If an overrange condition occurs, the corresponding element of the array contains IEEE NaN and the method returns an overrange error.
member.param: The maximum time allowed for the measurement to complete in milliseconds. May also be a value defined in IviDmmMaxTimeEnum.

member.name: M:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmMeasurement.Read(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initiates a measurement, waits for the DMM to return to the idle state, and returns the measured value. If an overrange condition occurrs, the value contains IEEE NaN and the method returns an overrange error.
member.param: The maximum time allowed for the measurement to complete in milliseconds. May also be a value defined in IviDmmMaxTimeEnum.

member.name: M:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmMeasurement.ReadMultiPoint(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initiates a measurement, waits for the DMM to return to the idle state, and returns an array of values. If an overrange condition occurs, the corresponding element of the array contains IEEE NaN and the method returns an overrange error.
member.param: The maximum time allowed for the measurement to complete in milliseconds. May also be a value defined in IviDmmMaxTimeEnum.

member.name: M:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmMeasurement.SendSoftwareTrigger
member.summary: Sends a software trigger, which causes the DMM to take a measurement.

member.name: M:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmMeasurement.IsOverRange(System.Double)
member.summary: Takes a measurement value obtained from one of the Read or Fetch methods and determines if the value is a valid measurement value or a value indicating that an overrange condition occurred.
member.param: The measurement value from one of the Read or Fetch functions.
member.returns: True if the measurement value indicates an overrange condition and false otherwise.

member.name: T:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmTemperature
member.summary: IVI DMM class-compliant temperature interface

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmTemperature.TransducerType
member.summary: The type of device used to measure the temperature. This property affects instrument behavior only when Function is set to a temperature measurement.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmTemperature.RTD
member.summary: Pointer to the class-compliant IIviDmmRtd interface

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmTemperature.Thermocouple
member.summary: Pointer to the class-compliant IIviDmmThermocouple interface

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmTemperature.Thermistor
member.summary: Pointer to the class-compliant IIviDmmThermistor interface

member.name: T:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmRTD
member.summary: IVI DMM class-compliant RTD interface

member.name: M:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmRTD.Configure(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Configures the Alpha and Resistance parameters for a resistance temperature device.
member.param: The alpha parameter for a resistance temperature device (RTD).
The R0 parameter (resistance) for a resistance temperature device (RTD) also known as the RTD reference value.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmRTD.Alpha
member.summary: The alpha parameter for a resistance temperature device (RTD). Applies only when the Temperature Transducer Type is set to 2 Wire RTD or 4 Wire RTD.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmRTD.Resistance
member.summary: The R0 parameter (resistance) for a resistance temperature device (RTD). Also known as the RTD reference value. Applies only when the Temperature Transducer Type is set to 2 Wire RTD or 4 Wire RTD.

member.name: T:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmThermocouple
member.summary: IVI DMM class-compliant thermocouple interface

member.name: M:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmThermocouple.Configure(Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmThermocoupleTypeEnum,Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmRefJunctionTypeEnum)
member.summary: Configures the thermocouple Type and RefJunctionType properties of a thermocouple. Applies only when the Temperature Transducer Type is Thermocouple.
member.param: The type of thermocouple used to measure the temperature.
The type of reference junction used in the reference junction compensation.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmThermocouple.FixedRefJunction
member.summary: The external reference junction temperature when a fixed reference junction thermocouple is used to measure temperature, or the thermocouple junction temperature of an instrument without an internal temperature sensor, in degrees Celcius.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmThermocouple.RefJunctionType
member.summary: The type of reference junction to be used in the reference junction compensation of a thermocouple measurement. Applies only when the Temperature Transducer Type is Thermocouple.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmThermocouple.Type
member.summary: The type of thermocouple used to measure the temperature. Applies only when the Temperature Transducer Type is Thermocouple.

member.name: T:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmThermistor
member.summary: IVI DMM class-compliant thermistor interface

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmThermistor.Resistance
member.summary: The resistance of the thermistor in Ohms. Applies only when the Temperature Transducer Type property is Thermistor.

member.name: T:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmTrigger
member.summary: IVI DMM class-compliant trigger interface

member.name: M:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmTrigger.Configure(Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmTriggerSourceEnum,System.Double)
member.summary: Configures the trigger Source and Delay properties.
member.param: Trigger source.

The length of time between when the DMM receives the trigger and when it takes a measurement. Use positive values to set the trigger delay in seconds. Negative values are reserved for the auto delay mode.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmTrigger.Slope
member.summary: The polarity of the external trigger slope, which determines whether the DMM triggers on either the rising or the falling edge of the external trigger source.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmTrigger.Delay
member.summary: The interval between the time when the DMM receives the trigger and the time when it takes a measurement. Positive values set the trigger delay in seconds. Negative values set auto delay mode.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmTrigger.Source
member.summary: The trigger source.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmTrigger.MultiPoint
member.summary: Pointer to the class-compliant IIviDmmMultipoint interface

member.name: T:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmMultiPoint
member.summary: IVI DMM class-compliant multipoint interface

member.name: M:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmMultiPoint.Configure(System.Int32,System.Int32,Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmSampleTriggerEnum,System.Double)
member.summary: Configures multipoint trigger Count, SampleCount, SampleTrigger and SampleInterval properties.
member.param: The number of triggers the DMM accepts before it returns to the idle state.
The number of measurements the DMM takes each time it receives a trigger.

The sample trigger source. If the value of the Sample Count is greater than 1, the DMM enters the Wait-For-Sample-Trigger state after taking a single measurement. When the event specified by this parameter occurs, the DMM exits the Wait-For-Sample-Trigger state and takes the next measurement.
The interval between samples in seconds.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmMultiPoint.MeasurementComplete
member.summary: The destination of the measurement-complete signal generated after each measurement.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmMultiPoint.Count
member.summary: The number of triggers the DMM accepts before it returns to the idle state.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmMultiPoint.SampleCount
member.summary: The number of measurements the DMM takes each time it receives a trigger.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmMultiPoint.SampleInterval
member.summary: The interval between samples in seconds. Applies only when Sample Count is greater than 1 and Sample Trigger is Interval.

member.name: P:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IIviDmmMultiPoint.SampleTrigger
member.summary: The sample trigger source. If the value of the Sample Count is greater than 1, the DMM enters the Wait-For-Sample-Trigger state after taking a single measurement. When a sample trigger occurs, the DMM takes the next measurement.

member.summary: The DMM takes one a Zero Reading immediately and then disables the auto-zero feature.

member.name: T:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmTriggerSourceEnum
member.summary: IVI DMM class-compliant values for trigger Source

member.name: F:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmTriggerSourceEnum.IviDmmTriggerSourceImmediate
member.summary: The DMM exits the Wait-For-Trigger state immediately after entering. It does not wait for a trigger of any kind.

member.name: F:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmTriggerSourceEnum.IviDmmTriggerSourceExternal
member.summary: The DMM exits the Wait-For-Trigger state when a trigger occurs on the external trigger input.

member.name: F:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmTriggerSourceEnum.IviDmmTriggerSourceSwTrigFunc
member.summary: The DMM exits the Wait-For-Trigger state when the Send Software Trigger function executes.

member.name: F:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmTriggerSourceEnum.IviDmmTriggerSourceTTL0

member.name: T:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmTriggerSlopeEnum

member.name: F:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmTriggerSlopeEnum.IviDmmTriggerSlopePositive
member.summary: Sets the trigger event to occur on the rising edge of the trigger pulse.

member.name: F:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmTriggerSlopeEnum.IviDmmTriggerSlopeNegative
member.summary: Sets the trigger event to occur on the rising edge of the trigger pulse.

member.name: T:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmSampleTriggerEnum
member.summary: IVI DMM class-compliant values for multipoint SampleTrigger

member.name: F:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmSampleTriggerEnum.IviDmmSampleTriggerImmediate
member.summary: The DMM exits the Wait-For-Sample-Trigger state immediately after entering. It does not wait for a trigger of any kind.

member.name: F:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmSampleTriggerEnum.IviDmmSampleTriggerExternal
member.summary: The DMM exits the Wait-For-Sample-Trigger state when a trigger occurs on the external trigger input.

member.name: F:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmSampleTriggerEnum.IviDmmSampleTriggerSwTrigFunc
member.summary: The DMM exits the Wait-For-Sample-Trigger state when the Send Software Trigger function executes.

member.name: T:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmErrorCodesEnum
member.summary: IVI DMM class defined HRESULTS

member.name: F:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmErrorCodesEnum.E_IVIDMM_TRIGGER_NOT_SOFTWARE
member.summary: The trigger source is not set to software trigger.

member.name: F:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmErrorCodesEnum.E_IVIDMM_MAX_TIME_EXCEEDED
member.summary: Max Time Exceeded

member.name: F:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmErrorCodesEnum.S_IVIDMM_OVER_RANGE
member.summary: Over Range

member.name: T:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmAutoRangeEnum
member.summary: IVI DMM class-compliant AutoRange values that can be used for Range

member.name: F:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmAutoRangeEnum.IviDmmAutoRangeOn
member.summary: Sets the DMM to calculate the range before each measurement automatically.

member.name: F:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmAutoRangeEnum.IviDmmAutoRangeOff
member.summary: Disables auto-ranging.

member.name: F:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmAutoRangeEnum.IviDmmAutoRangeOnce
member.summary: Sets the DMM to calculate the range before the next measurement and then disable auto-ranging.

member.name: T:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmFrequencyVoltageRangeEnum
member.summary: IVI DMM class-compliant values for frequency VoltageRange

member.name: F:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmFrequencyVoltageRangeEnum.IviDmmFrequencyVoltageRangeAutoRangeOn
member.summary: Sets the DMM to calculate the frequency voltage range before each measurement automatically.

member.name: F:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmFrequencyVoltageRangeEnum.IviDmmFrequencyVoltageRangeAutoRangeOff
member.summary: Disables auto-ranging.

member.name: T:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmMaxTimeEnum
member.summary: IVI DMM class-compliant values for MaxTime

member.name: F:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmMaxTimeEnum.IviDmmMaxTimeInfinite
member.summary: Wait indefinitely for the measurement to complete.

member.name: F:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmMaxTimeEnum.IviDmmMaxTimeImmediate
member.summary: Return immediately. If no valid measurement value exists, return an error.

member.name: T:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmTriggerDelayEnum
member.summary: IVI DMM class-compliant values for trigger Delay

member.name: F:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmTriggerDelayEnum.IviDmmTriggerDelayAutoDelayOn
member.summary: Sets the DMM to calculate the trigger delay before each measurement.

member.name: F:Ivi.Dmm.Interop.IviDmmTriggerDelayEnum.IviDmmTriggerDelayAutoDelayOff
member.summary: Stops the DMM from calculating the trigger delay.
